original_title: Sri Lanka ruling party MP Ranjith Bandara reappointed COPE chair
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka ruling party MP Ranjith Bandara has been reappointed chair of the parliamentary Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE).
Bandara defeated main opposition Samagi Jana Balaweaya (SJB) candidate Eran Wickrmaratne 16 votes to seven for the position on Thursday February 23.
Bandara is reportedly a close ally of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) national organiser and former Finance Minister Bastil Rajapaksa.
Meanwhile, former Committee on Public Finance (COPF) chairman SJB MP Harsha de Silva was replaced on Thursday by his party colleague Mayantha Dissanayake.
Mayantha Dissanayake replaces Harsha de Silva as Sri Lanka COPF chair, invites criticismSee more
MP de Silva complained that all government MPs had backed Dissanayake’s appointment.
SJB member and former Weligama Urban Council chairman Rehan Jayawickrama hinted that Dissanayake’s appointment was an attempt by the government to divide the SJB. (Colombo/Feb23/2023)
